parameters.adt: average daily traffic count in thousands
parameters.trks: truck volume as a percent of the total volume
parameters.htype:
An indicator of the type of roadway or the source of funding
for the road, either MC, FAI, PA, or  MA
parameters.lane: total number of lanes of traffic
parameters.shld: width in feet of outer shoulder on the roadway
parameters.len: length of the Highway1 segment in miles
parameters.sigs1:
(number of signalized interchanges per mile times len + 1)/len, the number
of signals per mile of roadway, adjusted to have no zero values.
parameters.itg: number of freeway-type interchanges per mile
parameters.acpt: number of access points per mile
parameters.rate: 1973 accident rate per million vehicle miles

title: Highway Accidents
description:
Description
The data comes from a unpublished master's paper by Carl Hoffstedt. They relate the automobile accident rate, 
in accidents per million vehicle miles to several potential terms.  The data include 39 sections of large 
highways in the state of Minnesota in 1973.  The goal of this analysis was to understand the impact 
of design variables, Acpts, Slim, Sig, and Shld that are under the control of 
the highway department, on accidents.
reference:
Carl Hoffstedt.  This differs from the dataset Highway in the
alr4 package only by addition of transformation of some of the columns.
format: This data frame contains the following columns:
